meanings.sent1: The cheetah is a pacy animal, able to run very fast.
meanings.sent2: The race car had a pacy speed around the track.
meanings.sent3: The pacy squirrel zipped through the trees, gathering nuts in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by at a pacy pace during the exciting game.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed at a pacy rate, carrying leaves swiftly downstream.

meanings.sent2: The concert was pacy, with the crowd dancing and cheering.
meanings.sent3: The pacy puppy wagged its tail enthusiastically, ready to play fetch.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat pacy with anticipation as she waited for the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The festival was pacy, with colorful decorations and lively music.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a fast pace or tempo
meanings.sent1: The movie had a pacy storyline that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: The pacy music at the party had everyone on their feet dancing.
meanings.sent3: The chef's pacy cooking style made the dinner preparation exciting.
meanings.sent4: The pacy rhythm of the drums set the tone for the energetic performance.
meanings.sent5: The pacy delivery of the news kept viewers informed and entertained.
